text: i have a client named barry i mean he's 80 doing like i call it the berry get up like his get up variation and he can get off the floor from his back only using one hand touching the floor that is so important and it's important to also understand what the implication of not being able to do that is right there's a safety part of this if you fall and you can't get up without someone assisting you there's an enormous safety problem if you live alone or something like that let's put that aside for a moment and just talk quality of life kids play low like you can basically be stuck in a rocking chair sitting back in the room and not being a participant with them or you can get to get the doll play in the dollhouse and get on the floor because if you can't get up on your own i just think you're going to be less likely to do it and i think if you're less likely to do it you're going to start to pull back and distance yourself from those activities it's a whole like spirit thing too right yeah
title: Training for Longevity | Peter Attia, M.D. & Beth Lewis #shorts
